title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: njcensus package provides tools working New Jersey Census demographic data. supports 2010 2020 census years offers functions downloading, processing, analyzing population data race gender across counties municipalities.

title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: initialize census database: function: Creates DuckDB database file Downloads processes 2010 2020 census data Optionally adds population estimates data (2021-2023) Sets necessary tables querying database already exists, intelligently: Use existing census data add population estimates requested already present Fetching fresh data Census API: pre-packaged data approach recommended : ’s significantly faster Doesn’t depend API availability Works without internet connection Avoids API rate limits Census data 2010 2020 static
code: # Initialize with just census data init_census_data()  # Initialize with census data and population estimates init_census_data(include_pop_estimates = TRUE) init_census_data(use_packaged_data = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: retrieve data specific demographic group year:
code: # Get preview of all demographics preview <- get_census_data() preview  # Shows formatted table  # Use defaults (white males in 2020) default_data <- get_census_data("white") default_data  # Shows formatted table  # Specific query asian_female_2010 <- get_census_data("asian", "female", 2010) asian_female_2010  # Shows formatted table

title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: package supports demographic groups: white boaa (Black African American) aian (American Indian Alaska Native) asian nhpi (Native Hawaiian Pacific Islander) others two_more (Two races)

title: Getting Started with njcensus
code: # Get Asian population data for 2020 asian_male_2020 <- get_census_data("asian", "male", 2020) asian_female_2020 <- get_census_data("asian", "female", 2020)  # Combine and analyze by county asian_by_county <- asian_male_2020 %>%   full_join(asian_female_2020, by = c("county", "county_name")) %>%   group_by(county_name) %>%   summarize(     total_population = sum(Total_Male, Total_Female, na.rm = TRUE)   ) %>%   arrange(desc(total_population))  head(asian_by_county)

title: Getting Started with njcensus
code: # Get data for a specific demographic data <- get_census_data("white", "male", 2020)  # Analyze age distribution age_distribution <- data %>%   select(matches("_years$")) %>%   summarize(across(everything(), sum)) %>%   tidyr::pivot_longer(everything(),                       names_to = "age_group",                       values_to = "count")  # View the first few age groups head(age_distribution)

title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: Compare population changes 2010 2020:
code: # Get data for both years data_2010 <- get_census_data("asian", "female", 2010) data_2020 <- get_census_data("asian", "female", 2020)  # Calculate population change by county population_change <- data_2010 %>%   select(county_name, Total_Female) %>%   rename(pop_2010 = Total_Female) %>%   full_join(     data_2020 %>%       select(county_name, Total_Female) %>%       rename(pop_2020 = Total_Female),     by = "county_name"   ) %>%   mutate(     change = pop_2020 - pop_2010,     percent_change = (change / pop_2010) * 100   ) %>%   arrange(desc(percent_change))  head(population_change)

title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: can specify custom location census database:
code: # Set custom database path set_db_path("/path/to/your/census_data.duckdb")  # Get current database path get_db_path()

title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: fetch fresh data Census API:
code: init_census_data(use_packaged_data = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with njcensus
text: Memory Management: package uses DuckDB efficient data storage retrieval. large queries, consider using dplyr’s lazy evaluation. Database Connection: package handles database connections automatically. don’t need manage connections manually. Error Handling: functions include input validation informative error messages.

title: Getting Started with njcensus
code: sessionInfo()

title: Working with Population Estimates
text: addition decennial census data, njcensus package now provides access Census Bureau’s Population Estimates Program data New Jersey counties. vignette demonstrates access analyze data. Accessing Population Estimates Population estimates data can accessed using get_pop_estimates() function. default, returns age-sex data available years counties.
code: # Get all age-sex estimates pop_data <- get_pop_estimates()  # View the first few rows head(pop_data)

title: Working with Population Estimates
text: package supports three types population estimate files: agesex: Age sex data (default) alldata: demographic data including race ethnicity syasex: Single-year age sex data can specify type want:
code: # Get all demographic data demo_data <- get_pop_estimates(file_type = "alldata")  # Get single-year age and sex data single_year <- get_pop_estimates(file_type = "syasex")

title: Working with Population Estimates
text: function offers several filtering options:

title: Working with Population Estimates
code: # Get estimates for Atlantic County atlantic <- get_pop_estimates(counties = "Atlantic")  # Get estimates for multiple counties south_jersey <- get_pop_estimates(   counties = c("Atlantic", "Cape May", "Cumberland") )

title: Working with Population Estimates
code: # Get only 2023 estimates latest <- get_pop_estimates(years = 2023)  # Get estimates for a range of years recent <- get_pop_estimates(years = c(2022, 2023))

title: Working with Population Estimates
code: # Get all agesex data pop_data <- get_pop_estimates()  # Calculate county totals by year county_trends <- pop_data %>%   filter(AGEGRP == 0) %>%  # Total population (all ages)   group_by(CTYNAME, YEAR) %>%   summarize(     Total = sum(TOT_POP),     .groups = "drop"   ) %>%   arrange(CTYNAME, YEAR)  # View the trends head(county_trends)

title: Working with Population Estimates
code: # Get recent population estimates pop_2023 <- get_pop_estimates(years = 2023)  # Analyze age distribution age_distribution <- pop_2023 %>%   filter(AGEGRP > 0) %>%  # Exclude total population row   group_by(AGEGRP) %>%   summarize(     Population = sum(TOT_POP),     .groups = "drop"   ) %>%   mutate(     Percentage = (Population / sum(Population)) * 100   )  # View the age distribution head(age_distribution)

title: Working with Population Estimates
text: can also compare decennial census data recent population estimates:
code: # Get 2020 census data census_2020 <- get_census_data("white", "male", 2020) %>%   group_by(county_name) %>%   summarize(Census_2020_Total = sum(Total))  # Get 2023 estimates estimates_2023 <- get_pop_estimates(years = 2023) %>%   filter(AGEGRP == 0) %>%  # Total population   group_by(CTYNAME) %>%   summarize(Estimate_2023_Total = sum(TOT_POP))  # Rename column for joining estimates_2023 <- estimates_2023 %>%   rename(county_name = CTYNAME)  # Join and calculate change comparison <- census_2020 %>%   left_join(estimates_2023, by = "county_name") %>%   mutate(     Change = Estimate_2023_Total - Census_2020_Total,     Percent_Change = (Change / Census_2020_Total) * 100   )  # View comparison head(comparison)

title: Working with Population Estimates
text: Population estimates provide valuable data years decennial censuses. njcensus package makes easy access analyze data alongside comprehensive decennial census data.

title: Authors and Citation
text: George Arthur. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {njcensus: Process New Jersey Census Data},   author = {George Arthur},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.1},   url = {https://prigasg.github.io/njcensus}, }

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
text: njcensus R package downloading, processing, analyzing New Jersey census demographic data. supports 2010 2020 census years provides tools working demographic indicators across counties municipalities. also includes population estimates data 2021-2023.

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
text: Downloads demographic data Census Bureau API Processes population data race gender Stores results DuckDB database efficient querying Supports 2010 2020 census years Includes population estimates 2021-2023 Handles county municipality level data

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
text: can install development version njcensus GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("PrigasG/njcensus")  #or using this link install.packages('https://github.com/PrigasG/njcensus/archive/refs/heads/main.zip', repos=NULL, type='source')

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
code: library(njcensus)  # Initialize using pre-packaged data (recommended) init_census_data()  # Or fetch fresh data from Census API (optional) init_census_data(use_packaged_data = FALSE)  # Initialize without population estimates init_census_data(include_pop_estimates = FALSE)

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
code: # Get preview of all demographics preview <- get_census_data()  # Get data for white males in 2020 (default) default_data <- get_census_data("white")  # Get specific data asian_female_2010 <- get_census_data("asian", "female", 2010)  # Filter by county atlantic_data <- get_census_data("white", counties = "Atlantic")  # Filter by municipality jersey_city_data <- get_census_data("white", municipalities = "Jersey City")

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
code: # Get population estimates data (agesex is default) pop_data <- get_pop_estimates()  # Get specific file type alldata <- get_pop_estimates(file_type = "alldata")  # Filter by county and year atlantic_2023 <- get_pop_estimates(counties = "Atlantic", years = 2023)

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
text: package includes pre-packaged Census data better performance reliability: Faster initialization API rate limits Works offline Consistent data access

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
text: package supports following demographic groups: white boaa (Black African American) aian (American Indian Alaska Native) asian nhpi (Native Hawaiian Pacific Islander) others two_more (Two races)

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
text: Process census data specific year: Querying demographic data
code: # Process 2020 census data process_census_data(2020) # Get data for specific demographics data <- get_census_data(   demographic = "asian",   gender = "female",   year = 2020 )  # View the first few rows head(data)

title: Process New Jersey Census Data
text: Data stored DuckDB database tables named according pattern: Census data: {demographic}{gender}{year} (e.g., white_male_2020) Population estimates: pop_estimates_{file_type} (e.g., pop_estimates_agesex)

what: Read Census Data from DuckDB — get_census_data
title: Read Census Data from DuckDB — get_census_data
text: Retrieves census data specified demographic group, gender, year. specific parameters provided, returns preview demographics. Returns data formatted table view easy reading.

title: Read Census Data from DuckDB — get_census_data
code: get_census_data(   demographic = NULL,   gender = "male",   year = 2020,   preview_limit = 10,   counties = NULL,   municipalities = NULL )

title: Read Census Data from DuckDB — get_census_data
text: demographic Character. Demographic group (e.g., "white", "asian", "boaa"). NULL, returns preview groups. gender Character. Gender ("male" "female"). Defaults "male". year Numeric. Census year (2010 2020). Defaults 2020. preview_limit Numeric. Number rows return demographic specified. Defaults 10. counties Character vector. County names filter . NULL (default), returns data counties. municipalities Character vector. Municipality names filter . NULL (default), returns data municipalities.

title: Read Census Data from DuckDB — get_census_data
text: data frame class 'census_data' containing requested census data, formatted printing capabilities.

title: Read Census Data from DuckDB — get_census_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get preview of all demographics preview <- get_census_data()  # Get data with defaults (white males in 2020) default_data <- get_census_data("white")  # Get specific data asian_female_2010 <- get_census_data("asian", "female", 2010)  # Filter by county atlantic_data <- get_census_data("white", counties = "Atlantic")  # Filter by municipality jersey_city_data <- get_census_data("white", municipalities = "Jersey City") } # }

title: Initialize Census Database — init_census_data
text: Creates initializes census database 2010 2020 census data. Data fetched Census API.

title: Initialize Census Database — init_census_data
code: init_census_data(   worker_threads = parallel::detectCores() - 1,   memory_limit = "4GB",   include_pop_estimates = FALSE,   pop_estimate_years = c(2021, 2022, 2023) )

title: Initialize Census Database — init_census_data
text: worker_threads Integer. Number threads parallel processing fetching API. memory_limit Character. Memory limit DuckDB (default: "4GB"). include_pop_estimates Logical. Whether include population estimates data. Default FALSE. pop_estimate_years Numeric vector. Years include population estimates. Default c(2021, 2022, 2023).

title: Initialize Census Database — init_census_data
text: None. Creates initializes census database.

title: Initialize Census Database — init_census_data
text: function fetches data Census API processes DuckDB database. Census data 2010 2020 always fetched Population estimates can optionally included database already exists, check existing tables add missing ones

title: Initialize Census Database — init_census_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Initialize with just census data init_census_data()  # Initialize with census data and population estimates init_census_data(include_pop_estimates = TRUE)  # Customize API fetch settings init_census_data(   worker_threads = 4,   memory_limit = "8GB" ) } # }

what: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
title: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
text: Downloads processes census demographic data New Jersey specified year. data written DuckDB database analysis.

title: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
code: process_census_data(year)

title: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
text: year Integer. census year process data . Must either 2010 2020.

title: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
text: None. Results stored local DuckDB database file (census_data.duckdb).

title: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
text: function fetches demographic data (e.g., race gender-specific counts) counties municipalities New Jersey. utilizes Census Bureau API processes data DuckDB database. Progress tracked via console messages.

title: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
text: Handles 2010 2020 census data. Dynamically generates API queries column mappings based year. Writes results tables DuckDB database.

title: Process Census Data for New Jersey — process_census_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Process data for the 2020 census process_census_data(2020)  # Process data for the 2010 census process_census_data(2010) } # }

what: Process Population Estimates Data for New Jersey — process_pop_estimates
title: Process Population Estimates Data for New Jersey — process_pop_estimates
text: Downloads processes population estimates data New Jersey counties. Data obtained Census Bureau's Population Estimates Program.

title: Process Population Estimates Data for New Jersey — process_pop_estimates
code: process_pop_estimates(   years = c(2021, 2022, 2023),   file_types = c("agesex", "alldata", "syasex"),   state_fips = "34",   save_to_db = TRUE )

title: Process Population Estimates Data for New Jersey — process_pop_estimates
text: years Numeric vector. Years process data (e.g., c(2021, 2022, 2023)). file_types Character vector. Types estimates files process. Options include 'agesex' (age sex), 'alldata' (demographic data), 'syasex' (single-year age sex). state_fips Character. State FIPS code. Default "34" New Jersey. save_to_db Logical. Whether save data census database. Default TRUE.

title: Process Population Estimates Data for New Jersey — process_pop_estimates
text: list data frames, one file type requested. save_to_db TRUE, also saves census database.

title: Process Population Estimates Data for New Jersey — process_pop_estimates
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Process population estimates for 2021-2023, all file types pop_data <- process_pop_estimates(c(2021, 2022, 2023))  # Process only age-sex data for 2022 pop_data <- process_pop_estimates(2022, file_types = "agesex") } # }

title: njcensus 0.2.0
text: Added pre-packaged census data support improve reliability speed Modified init_census_data() use packaged data default Added population estimates data functionality (2021-2023) Added filtering capabilities counties municipalities

title: njcensus 0.2.0
text: New parameter use_packaged_data init_census_data() New parameter include_pop_estimates optionally include population estimates Added get_pop_estimates() function accessing population estimates data Added county municipality filtering get_census_data() Improved database initialization smart detection existing data Reduced dependency Census API

title: njcensus 0.2.0
text: Added proper system dependencies Improved error handling database operations Enhanced test coverage Made console messages professional Fixed syasex file availability issue (available 2023+) Improved namespace management zzz.R approach

title: njcensus 0.1.0
text: Added initial database operations init_census_data() get_census_data() Implemented Census API data retrieval 2010 2020 Added support demographic data race gender Created DuckDB backend efficient data storage

title: njcensus 0.1.0
text: Fixed database path handling test environments Corrected memory limit settings DuckDB configuration

title: njcensus 0.1.0
text: Added comprehensive vignette examples Created README installation basic usage instructions
